Question_1.Context: Yeast isolates were tested for their ability to grow at different temperatures. The growth profile of yeast isolates at various temperatures is shown in the text.
Question_1.Question: Which temperature showed the most significant growth for isolates SL7 and OPT4B?
Question_1.Source: The most rapid growth of isolates SL7 and OPT4B occurred at 30°C, while isolates SL1(1), SL6, SL3, and R5 at 37°C.

Question_2.Context: Yeast isolates were tested for their ability to produce xylitol from xylose substrate. The xylitol production profiles by yeast isolates are shown in the text.
Question_2.Question: Which yeast isolate produced the highest amount of xylitol?
Question_2.Source: Isolate SL7 produced 6.0 g/L of xylitol from xylose substrate, the highest among the tested isolates.

Question_3.Context: Yeast isolates were tested for their ability to consume xylose and produce xylitol. The xylitol production profiles by yeast isolates are shown in the text.
Question_3.Question: Which yeast isolate showed the lowest xylitol production?
Question_3.Source: Isolate SL6 produced 5.0 g/L of xylitol from xylose substrate, the lowest among the tested isolates.

Question_4.Context: Yeast isolates were tested for their ability to produce ethanol from xylose substrate. The ethanol production profiles by yeast isolates are shown in the text.
Question_4.Question: Which yeast isolate produced the highest amount of ethanol from xylose substrate?
Question_4.Source: Isolate R5 produced 1.34 g/L of ethanol from xylose substrate, the highest among the tested isolates.

Question_5.Context: Yeast isolates were tested for their ability to produce ethanol from glucose and xylose substrates. The ethanol production profiles by yeast isolates are shown in the text.
Question_5.Question: Which yeast isolate produced the lowest amount of ethanol from xylose substrate?
Question_5.Source: Isolate SL7 produced 0.85 g/L of ethanol from xylose substrate, the lowest among the tested isolates.

Question_6.Context: Yeast isolates were tested for their ability to produce ethanol from glucose and xylose substrates. The ethanol production profiles by yeast isolates are shown in the text.
Question_6.Question: Which yeast isolate produced the highest amount of ethanol from glucose substrate?
Question_6.Source: Isolate R5 produced 70.75 g/L of ethanol from glucose substrate, the highest among the tested isolates.

Question_7.Context: Yeast isolates were tested for their ability to grow at different temperatures. The growth profile of yeast isolates at various temperatures is shown in the text.
Question_7.Question: At which temperature did all isolates show a decrease in cell density?
Question_7.Source: Although the cell density of all isolates decreased at temperatures above 37°C, the growth of all isolates was quite significant at 42°C.

Question_9.Question: Which yeast isolate produced the lowest amount of ethanol from glucose substrate?
